required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Sublingual and Transdermal Administration of Nitroglycerin for Coronary CT Angiography on Image Quality
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Sublingual and Transdermal Administration of Nitroglycerin for Coronary CT Angiography on Image Quality

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate image quality of coronary CT angiography (cCTA) after sublingual and transdermal administration of Nitroglycerin. Aim of this prospective research study is to investigate equivalence on image quality after sublingual or transdermal Nitroglycerin administration (H0).
Furthermore, the feasibility of transdermal Nitroglycerin administration will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: obtained on the same day (day 0) of nitroglycerine administration (nitroglycerine is administered during the cCTA exam appointment).
primary_outcome.description: Average diameter of coronary arteries at 7 predefined locations in the proximal, mid, and distal segments of the left main, left anterior descending, left circumflex and right coronary artery. Measurements avoid areas of coronary non-calcified and calcified plaques and measured twice for each location. Proximal and distal deviation from original measurements is possible in case of plaque.

intervention.description: Patients grouped in sublingual administration (group 1 and 2) will receive Nitroglycerin during the cCTA scan by the MD after the Calcium scoring scan and 5 minutes before the actual cCTA scan. Patients categorized to transdermal administration will receive Nitroglycerin 1 hour before the CT examination. The patch will be placed on the chest or the upper arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Scheduled cCTA with contrast.
2. Able to comprehend and sign the consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known hypersensitivity to glyceryl trinitrate, and related organic nitrates.
2. Acute circulatory failure associated with marked hypotension (shock).
3. Conditions associated with elevated intracranial pressure, cerebral haemorrhage and head trauma.
4. Closed-angle glaucoma.
5. Phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE5) inhibitors such as sildenafil (ViagraÂ®), tadalafil (Cialis), or vardenafil (Levitra) within the last 24 hours
6. Unstable clinical conditions (i.e. hemodynamic instability, arrhythmias)
7. Critical aortic stenosis
8. Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg
9. Pregnant or lactating female; premenopausal women with a positive urine pregnancy test.
10. Age under 18
11. Unwilling or unable to inform consent.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Sublingual Nitroglycerin Spray
group.description: Sublingual Nitroglycerin spray of 0.8 mg Nitroglycerin: Patients grouped in sublingual administration (group 1 and 2) will receive Nitroglycerin during the cCTA scan by the MD after the Calcium scoring scan and 5 minutes before the actual cCTA scan. Patients categorized to transdermal administration will receive Nitroglycerin 1 hour before the CT examination. The patch will be placed on the chest or the upper arm.

Patients categorized to transdermal administration will receive Nitroglycerin 1 hour before the CT examination. The patch will be placed on the chest or the upper arm.

Patients categorized to transdermal administration will receive Nitroglycerin 1 hour before the CT examination. The patch will be placed on the chest or the upper arm.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.description: Average diameter of coronary arteries at 7 predefined locations in the proximal, mid, and distal segments of the left main, left anterior descending, left circumflex and right coronary artery. Measurements avoid areas of coronary non-calcified and calcified plaques and measured twice for each location. Proximal and distal deviation from original measurements is possible in case of plaque.

measure.description: Average diameter of coronary arteries at 7 predefined locations in the proximal, mid, and distal segments of the left main, left anterior descending, left circumflex and right coronary artery. Measurements avoid areas of coronary non-calcified and calcified plaques and measured twice for each location. Proximal and distal deviation from original measurements is possible in case of plaque.

reported_events.time_frame: From time of nitroglycerin was given until until patients left the Radiology department. Usually 1 hour after the exam.
reported_events.desc: There were no patients with serious adverse events. There were no patients with all-cause mortality. There were no patients with other adverse events.

group.title: Sublingual Nitroglycerin Spray
group.description: Sublingual Nitroglycerin spray of 0.8 mg Patients will receive Nitroglycerin during the cCTA scan by the MD after the Calcium scoring scan and 5 minutes before the actual cCTA scan.

group.title: Nitroglycerin Skin Patch
group.description: Nitroglycerin skin patch of 0.8 mg/h Patients categorized to transdermal administration will receive Nitroglycerin after Calcium scoring scan and 1 hour before the cCTA examination. The patch will be placed on the chest or the upper arm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: To evaluate coronary diameter change by nitroglycerin administration, non-constrast and contrast ECG-gated images were compared. Measurements avoided areas of visible arteriosclerosis.
